lines.text: Alas... how terrible is wisdom when it brings no profit to the wise, Johnny?
No matter how cleverly you sneak up on a mirror, your reflection always looks you straight in the eye.
They say there's enough religion in the world to make men hate each other, but not enough to make them love.
[last lines]
You're going to burn for this, Angel.
I know. In hell.
Are you an atheist?
Yeah, I'm from Brooklyn.
The flesh is weak, Johnny. Only the soul is immortal.
[darkly]
And yours belongs to ME.
Hey, you ever watch the Mickey Mouse Club? 'Cause you know what today... today is? Today is Wednesday. It's anything can happen day.

You're crazy. I know who I am. You're trying to frame me. You're trying to frame me. Cyphre, I know who I am. You murdered them people. I never killed nobody. I didn't kill Fowler, and... and I didn't kill Toots, and I didn't kill Margaret, and I didn't kill Krusemark, I didn't kill no-one!
I'm afraid you did, Johnny.
My name's not Johnny!

All killed by your own hand. Guided by me naturally. Frankly, you were doomed from the moment you slit that young boy in half, Johnny... for twelve years you've been living on borrowed time and another men's memories.
Hey I wanna tell Winesap cause he knows.

Winesap? Oh he's dead. Nasty accident. Don't worry. No-one will mourn one less lawyer in the world - there's death everywhere these days Johnny. But what gives human life its worth... anyway? Because someone loves it, hates it? The flesh is weak, Johnny. Only the soul is immortal. And yours belongs to ME.
You know what they say about slugs. They always leave slime in their tracks.
[repeated line]
I gotta thing about chickens.

She was doing my chart. I gave her Johnny's birthdate, February 14th. Except someone got to her and took out their own Valentine card. They split her open, and they cut out her heart. I guess she couldn't predict the future for herself.
The future isn't whay it used to be Mr. Angel.
I have old-fashioned ideas about honour. An eye for an eye... stuff like that.
What's your name?
Epiphany Proudfoot.
Your mother left you a very beautiful name, Epiphany.
Not much else.
Mephistopheles can be a mouthful in Manhattan, Johnny.

[to Izzy as he is lounging on a deserted beach at Coney Island, in what must be early Autumn]
Listen. What do you do around here in the summertime?
I bite the heads off rats.
What do you do in the winter?
The same.
[chuckles nonchalantly]

[Declining an offer for fresh-made Gumbo soup]
Cajun cooking kills me.

I want you to show right now how much you love God! I want you to show as your tithe! I want you to open up your hearts! And open up your wallets! And open up your purses! And give it up! Praise the Lord! Somebody's been talking about me, talking about I've been riding around in a Cadillac! If you love me, and you wanna give to me, then I should be in a Rolls Royce!

Hallelujah! Permit me to be transmittable, Hallelujah! Permit me to be reincarnatable, Hallelujah! Permit me to be reproducible, Hallelujah! For His Kingdom is yours! Today! Right now! Follow me! Follow me! Follow me through His peace! Yes! Oh Hallelujah!
Do you speak French, Mr. Angel?

[laughs]
I'm from Brooklyn.
You know, some religions think that the egg is the symbol of the soul, did you know that?
No, I didn't know that.
Would you like an egg?
No thank you, I got a thing about chickens.
[Louis takes a bit out of an egg with a dangerous look on his face]
[repeated lines]

[shouting]
Who was the boy?
[first lines]
Johnny. Johnny. Johnny.
You'd have enjoyed our gumbo.
I know who I am!
Winesap. You want his number? You want his address? Ask Tess Trueheart over there. It's in the book he's flipping through. It's under "W" genius.
You know Ted Williams the baseball player?
Yeah.
Who are you? How did you get in here?
Through the mail slot.
